titleInfo.title: N.H. Rahn in Macon, Georgia to Mr. Dehon in Spartanburg, South Carolina

subject.topic: Segment block; clay products; sanitary sewers.

subject.geographic: Macon, Georgia; Spartanburg, South Carolina; Western Carolinas; Tennessee.

subject.topic: Rahn, N. H.; Southern Pipe and Culvert Company; Kingsport Brick Corporation; Carolina, Clinchfield and Ohio Railways.

mods.note: This letter is written by N. H. Rahn in Macon, Georgia, to Mr. Dehon in Spartanburg, South Carolina. The Southern Pipe and Culvert Company negotiated with Kingsport Brick Corporation to manufacture Segment Block for distribution in Tennessee and the Western Carolinas. A plant was constructed in Macon, Georgia, as the production site, and the machinery will be assumed by the Carolina, Clinchfield and Ohio Railway. The letter advises Mr. Dehon to negotiate the contract with the Kingsport plant.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
